verbose_text: It is known that the rate limiting enzyme dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (DPD), which is encoded by the DPYD gene, deactivates more than 80% of standard oral doses of 5-FU and its prodrug, capecitabine [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: rate-limiting enzyme dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (DPD), which is encoded by the DPYD gene, deactivates more than 80% of standard oral doses of 5-FU
